intro: Phragmotheca mammosa subsp. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid climate of the Amazon rainforest. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
